job_title: SC Broadwood Paloma Terrace in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Residents are awesome! The job description says 28 hours, actual hours are 32 hours.
cons: The low pay. No benefits. No parking. No office equipment that works. On a daily basis office machine, aren't working, and IT needs to be called every day to attempt to fix the problem from 30 minutes to 2 hours. Property managers are not transparent and honest. Many Service Coordinators have worked here within 3 years, high turn-over. High expectations for low pay, low amount of work hours, stretching the SC over the hourly limit. A daily quota is expected in detailed online reports.

review_title: Horrendous management, low pay, working for about 3 people
job_title: Accounts Payable Clerk in Long Beach, CA
pros: Managers were flexible with schedules. Calling out was simple, leaving early for good reasons was usually approved. Paid medical, dental, and vision (even though copay was high and the amount discounted from your check was high as well), vacation time was the average 2 weeks per year.
cons: Low low low pay. Work was about the load for 3 people. Zero promotions in years, wage raises were literally only 3% increases so in years I only made like .50c extra yet my responsibilities increased dramatically. There was always miscommunication problems and management would get very loud & angry and seemed incapable of rational discussion. Mad with power types. Horrible mess of people. Almost zero holidays were given. Maybe 5 days a year were recognized.

review_title: Excellent company with morals and values
job_title: Human Resources Manager in Sacramento, CA
pros: This organization has morals and values which in my experience can be difficult to find these days. They appreciate their employees and work diligently to make your workplace a fun place to be. Most staff enjoy coming to work and are happy with thier positions.
cons: Not many people know about our company so it can be difficult to fill positions from time to time. I think it is mainly because we are not a huge corporation.

job_title: Maintenance Technician in Modesto, CA
pros: Helping retired people that really needed it due to managements unprofessional behavior.
cons: Most unprofessional, immature, ignorant, and mean management i have dealt with.  The regional manager is a joke. I can only assume this must be semi isolated to the area I was in, due to the fact this is a large organization.  They can’t all be this bad or they would exist....I hope..

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Jacksonville, FL
pros: The residents are the only pro of working here.
cons: Everything. Nothing but a company full of bullies and idiots. The treat their residents like numbered cattle and their employees like they're stupid. Low low wages. NO RAISES AT ALL. Barely anytime off. Benefits are very expensive. They run off existing employees of properties they buy and replace them with incompetent people. Residents and employees alike are VERY unhappy.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Clarksville, IN

cons: Management is very clique but over all good place to work.
